H0.text: which hormone is released from the ruptured follicle or corpus luteum. Progesterone

H1.text: which hormone is released from the ruptured follicle or corpus luteum. Testosterone

H2.text: which hormone is released from the ruptured follicle or corpus luteum. Relaxin

H3.text: which hormone is released from the ruptured follicle or corpus luteum. estrogen

A4.text: The corpus luteum secretes progesterone, which is a steroid hormone responsible for the decidualization of the endometrium (its development) and maintenance, respectively.

A5.text: It also produces relaxin, a hormone responsible for softening of the pubic symphysis which helps in parturition.

A6.text: Progesterone is produced in high amounts in the ovaries (by the corpus luteum) from the onset of puberty to menopause.
